title: Educational Language Game Design Based on Gameplay Loops for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and elementary-level language comprehension
context.additional_context: A course integrating game design with language learning in smartphone-centric, resource-constrained environments, providing continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the connection between language learning objectives and game mechanics by analyzing gameplay loop structures
Learners can design language game content suitable for the cognitive level of target learners (elementary students)
Learners can create a mobile-friendly game interface prototype executable in limited technology environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
